Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus, which dates from the second century B.C., was used to fill the cartonnage of a mummy. On the  recto, several traces of colours are still to be seen. The text contains an unknown poem, probably by the hand of the hellenistic poet Hermesianax (320-250 B.C.). The fragment which fits at the right side of the extract from Brussels is preserved at the Sorbonne (inv. 2254).
